title: Special room
data:
***Version Unknown**: This article **may not be** up to date for the [latest stable release](/0.32 "0.32") of Crawl.*

**Special rooms** are a unique kind of [vault](/Vault "Vault"). They are one-tile-border rectangular rooms of variable size (6 to 9 by 5 to 9) stuffed with up to [27](/27 "27") monsters, with tiny flat chances per valid branch and given layout. Multiple can appear per game (for most sets), unlike normal vaults, and their chances are unaffected by the number of mini-vaults implemented for a given branch. Many early roguelikes also have these styles of vault.

Special rooms can spawn in the [Dungeon](/The_Dungeon "The Dungeon"), the [Lair of Beasts](/The_Lair "The Lair"), the [Spider Nest](/Spider%27s_Nest "Spider's Nest"), the [Elven Halls](/Elven_Halls "Elven Halls"), the [Crypt](/The_Crypt "The Crypt"), the [Depths](/The_Depths "The Depths"), and the non-end floors of the [Orcish Mines](/Orcish_Mines "Orcish Mines"), the [Vaults](/The_Vaults "The Vaults"), the [Slime Pits](/The_Slime_Pits "The Slime Pits"), [Gehenna](/Gehenna "Gehenna"), [Cocytus](/Cocytus "Cocytus"), [Tartarus](/Tartarus "Tartarus"), and [the Iron City of Dis](/The_Iron_City_of_Dis "The Iron City of Dis"). Monster sets have explicit, coarse depth-scaling, so it is quite rare to find (for example) a Jelly Pit on Lair:8 in the first place. Most special rooms have some kind of meager items or mildly useful dungeon features built in as a reward. Most special rooms also have a chance for a boss, which can vary from simply guaranteeing the placement of the top of the depth-scaling range, to adding thematic further threats.

## Contents

- [1 Kobolds](#Kobolds)
- [2 Orcs](#Orcs)
- [3 Bee hive](#Bee_hive)
- [4 Morgue](#Morgue)
- [5 Jelly pit](#Jelly_pit)
- [6 Mythical zoo](#Mythical_zoo)
- [7 History](#History)

### Kobolds

One of the two sets that cannot repeat per-game.

**Depth**: [D:7-12](/The_Dungeon "The Dungeon"), [Orc:1-3](/Orcish_Mines "Orcish Mines")

**Monsters**: Kobolds and kobold brigands. The code contains further coarse scaling than is currently used, but still scales rather simply as follows:

|                                                                                                                                             |       |                 |
| ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- | ----- | --------------- |
| Chances                                                                                                                                     | D:7-8 | D:9-12, Orc:1-3 |
| K [![Kobold.png](/images/d/d2/Kobold.png)](/File:Kobold.png) **[Kobold](/Kobold_\(monster\) "Kobold (monster)")**                           | 50%   | 40%             |
| K [![Kobold brigand.png](/images/f/fd/Kobold_brigand.png)](/File:Kobold_brigand.png) **[Kobold brigand](/Kobold_brigand "Kobold brigand")** | 50%   | 60%             |

The boss monster is always a kobold brigand on D:7-11, but on D:12 and in Orc:1-3 there is a coinflip chance between it and the following:

- K [![Kobold demonologist.png](/images/f/f5/Kobold_demonologist.png)](/File:Kobold_demonologist.png) **[Kobold demonologist](/Kobold_demonologist "Kobold demonologist")**

### Orcs

**Depth**: [D:9-15](/The_Dungeon "The Dungeon"), [Orc:1-3](/Orcish_Mines "Orcish Mines"), [Elf](/Elven_Halls "Elven Halls"), [Vaults:1-4](/The_Vaults "The Vaults")

**Monsters**: [Orcs](/List_of_orcs "List of orcs"), alongside the occasional ogre or troll as seen in the Orcish Mines.

|                                                                                                                                                   |        |         |     |                |                 |
| ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- | ------ | ------- | --- | -------------- | --------------- |
| Depth                                                                                                                                             | D:9    | D:10-14 | Orc | D:15, Vaults:1 | Elf, Vaults:2-4 |
| o [![Orc.png](/images/b/bf/Orc.png)](/File:Orc.png) **[Orc](/Orc "Orc")**                                                                         | 88%    | 70%     | 60% | 45%            | 16.67%          |
| o [![Orc warrior.png](/images/2/25/Orc_warrior.png)](/File:Orc_warrior.png) **[Orc warrior](/Orc_warrior "Orc warrior")**                         | 10%    | 20%     | 25% | 25%            | 33.33%          |
| O [![Ogre.png](/images/c/c5/Ogre.png)](/File:Ogre.png) **[Ogre](/Ogre_\(monster\) "Ogre (monster)")**                                             | 2%     | 6%      | 0%  | 5%             | 3.33%           |
| o [![Orc priest.png](/images/5/55/Orc_priest.png)](/File:Orc_priest.png) **[Orc priest](/Orc_priest "Orc priest")**                               | 0%     | 4%      | 10% | 10%            | 13.33%          |
| o [![Orc knight.png](/images/1/16/Orc_knight.png)](/File:Orc_knight.png) **[Orc knight](/Orc_knight "Orc knight")**                               | 0%     |         | 5%  | 15%            | 26.67%          |
| o [![Orc high priest.png](/images/b/b1/Orc_high_priest.png)](/File:Orc_high_priest.png) **[Orc high priest](/Orc_high_priest "Orc high priest")** | 0%     |         |     |                | 3.33%           |
| T [![Troll.png](/images/f/f3/Troll.png)](/File:Troll.png) **[Troll](/Troll_\(monster\) "Troll (monster)")**                                       |        |         |     |                | 3.33%           |
| Boss                                                                                                                                              | D:9    | D:10-14 | Orc | D:15, Vaults:1 | Elf, Vaults:2-4 |
| o [![Orc warrior.png](/images/2/25/Orc_warrior.png)](/File:Orc_warrior.png) **[Orc warrior](/Orc_warrior "Orc warrior")**                         | 66.67% | 10%     | 0%  |                |                 |
| o [![Orc priest.png](/images/5/55/Orc_priest.png)](/File:Orc_priest.png) **[Orc priest](/Orc_priest "Orc priest")**                               | 33.33% | 70%     | 0%  |                |                 |
| o [![Orc knight.png](/images/1/16/Orc_knight.png)](/File:Orc_knight.png) **[Orc knight](/Orc_knight "Orc knight")**                               | 0%     | 20%     | 40% | 50%            | 0%              |
| o [![Orc sorcerer.png](/images/c/c6/Orc_sorcerer.png)](/File:Orc_sorcerer.png) **[Orc sorcerer](/Orc_sorcerer "Orc sorcerer")**                   | 0%     |         | 4%  | 0%             | 0%              |
| o [![Orc high priest.png](/images/b/b1/Orc_high_priest.png)](/File:Orc_high_priest.png) **[Orc high priest](/Orc_high_priest "Orc high priest")** |        |         | 36% | 45%            | 10%             |
| o [![Orc warlord.png](/images/7/76/Orc_warlord.png)](/File:Orc_warlord.png) **[Orc warlord](/Orc_warlord "Orc warlord")**                         |        |         | 5%  | 20%            | 90%             |

**Rewards**: There is a 11.11% chance per square for every square with a non-boss monster to have depth-adjusted low amounts of [gold](/Gold "Gold") on them, and the boss monster always stands on one regular slightly-level-adjusted pile of gold. On a coinflip chance, said boss monster also stands on an altar of Beogh.

### Bee hive

One of the two sets that cannot repeat per-game. Special rooms in Spider, which are always bee hives, have their walls randomly replaced with floor.

**Depth**: [D:9-15](/The_Dungeon "The Dungeon"), [Lair](/The_Lair "The Lair"), [Orc:1-3](/Orcish_Mines "Orcish Mines"), [Spider](/Spider%27s_Nest "Spider's Nest")

**Monsters**: By far the simplest of special\_rooms, containing one of the second and filling the room with the first:

- y [![Killer bee.png](/images/6/65/Killer_bee.png)](/File:Killer_bee.png) **[Killer bee](/Killer_bee "Killer bee")**
- y [![Queen bee.png](/images/7/7a/Queen_bee.png)](/File:Queen_bee.png) **[Queen bee](/Queen_bee "Queen bee")**

**Rewards**: Every square containing a bee has a 2% chance for a [royal jelly](/Royal_jelly_\(item\) "Royal jelly (item)"), a 48% chance for a [honeycomb](/Honeycomb "Honeycomb"), and a 50% chance to place nothing.

### Morgue

**Depth**: [Depths](/The_Depths "The Depths"), [Crypt](/The_Crypt "The Crypt"), [Gehenna](/Gehenna "Gehenna"), [Cocytus](/Cocytus "Cocytus"), Tartarus, [The Iron City of Dis](/The_Iron_City_of_Dis "The Iron City of Dis")

**Monsters**: Extremely varied spread of undead and related monsters, from [derived undead](/Derived_undead "Derived undead") to [demons](/Demons "Demons"). It is worth noting that the Hells will specify the weapon qualities of the skeletal warriors, vampire knights, and reapers: [flaming](/Flaming "Flaming") brand for Gehenna, [freezing](/Freezing "Freezing") brand for Cocytus, [draining](/Draining "Draining") brand for Tartarus, and any brand as is valid for the weapon in Dis. Said skeletal warriors and vampire knights are also exclusively equipped with either a [great mace](/Great_mace "Great mace"), a [glaive](/Glaive "Glaive"), or a [battleaxe](/Battleaxe "Battleaxe").

|                                                                                                                                                                        |               |                      |
| ---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- | ------------- | -------------------- |
| Monster                                                                                                                                                                | Depths chance | Crypt / Hells chance |
| z [![Small zombie.png](/images/7/7a/Small_zombie.png)](/File:Small_zombie.png) [Zombie](/Zombie "Zombie")                                                              | 20%           | 17.5%                |
| z [![Skeleton small humanoid.png](/images/6/6e/Skeleton_small_humanoid.png)](/File:Skeleton_small_humanoid.png) [Skeleton](/Skeleton_\(monster\) "Skeleton (monster)") | 7.14%         | 6.25%                |
| W [![Spectral small humanoid.png](/images/8/8a/Spectral_small_humanoid.png)](/File:Spectral_small_humanoid.png) [Spectral thing](/Spectral_thing "Spectral thing")     | 1.43%         | 1.25%                |
| W [![Shadow wraith.png](/images/8/80/Shadow_wraith.png)](/File:Shadow_wraith.png) **[Shadow wraith](/Shadow_wraith "Shadow wraith")**                                  | 2.86%         | 2.5%                 |
| 3 [![Soul eater.png](/images/8/88/Soul_eater.png)](/File:Soul_eater.png) **[Soul eater](/Soul_eater "Soul eater")**                                                    | 2.86%         | 2.5%                 |
| V [![Vampire (monster).png](/images/d/df/Vampire_%28monster%29.png)](/File:Vampire_\(monster\).png) **[Vampire](/Vampire_\(monster\) "Vampire (monster)")**            | 2.86%         | 2.5%                 |
| W [![Shadowghast.png](/images/7/71/Shadowghast.png)](/File:Shadowghast.png) **[Shadow](/Shadow "Shadow")**                                                             | 2.86%         | 2.5%                 |
| W [![Flayed ghost.png](/images/8/8b/Flayed_ghost.png)](/File:Flayed_ghost.png) **[Flayed ghost](/Flayed_ghost "Flayed ghost")**                                        | 2.86%         | 2.5%                 |
| z [![Skeletal warrior.png](/images/2/2f/Skeletal_warrior.png)](/File:Skeletal_warrior.png) **[Skeletal warrior](/Skeletal_warrior "Skeletal warrior")**                | 21.43%        | 18.75%               |
| V [![Vampire knight.png](/images/b/be/Vampire_knight.png)](/File:Vampire_knight.png) **[Vampire knight](/Vampire_knight "Vampire knight")**                            | 7.14%         | 6.25%                |
| 2 [![Reaper.png](/images/6/6a/Reaper.png)](/File:Reaper.png) **[Reaper](/Reaper "Reaper")**                                                                            | 0%            | 11.25%               |
| D [![Bone dragon.png](/images/3/31/Bone_dragon.png)](/File:Bone_dragon.png) **[Bone dragon](/Bone_dragon "Bone dragon")**                                              |               | 1.25%                |
| Branch specifics (collectively)                                                                                                                                        | 28.57%        | 25.00%               |

Said branch-specific monsters:

|                      |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                 |        |
| -------------------- | ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- | ------ |
| Branch               | Monsters                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                        | Chance |
| Depths               | @ [![Necromancer.png](/images/5/5d/Necromancer.png)](/File:Necromancer.png) **[Necromancer](/Necromancer_\(monster\) "Necromancer (monster)")**                                                                                                                                                                                 | 16.67% |
|                      | e [![Deep elf death mage.png](/images/5/5f/Deep_elf_death_mage.png)](/File:Deep_elf_death_mage.png) **[Deep elf death mage](/Deep_elf_death_mage "Deep elf death mage")**                                                                                                                                                       | 7.69%  |
|                      | D [![Shadow dragon.png](/images/3/3a/Shadow_dragon.png)](/File:Shadow_dragon.png) **[Shadow dragon](/Shadow_dragon "Shadow dragon")**                                                                                                                                                                                           | 7.69%  |
| Crypt / Tartarus     | W [![Eidolon.png](/images/1/1d/Eidolon.png)](/File:Eidolon.png) **[Eidolon](/Eidolon "Eidolon")**                                                                                                                                                                                                                               | 8.11%  |
|                      | V [![Jiangshi.png](/images/5/59/Jiangshi.png)](/File:Jiangshi.png) **[Jiangshi](/Jiangshi "Jiangshi")**                                                                                                                                                                                                                         | 7.69%  |
|                      | n [![Plague shambler.png](/images/d/d4/Plague_shambler.png)](/File:Plague_shambler.png) **[Plague shambler](/Plague_shambler "Plague shambler")**                                                                                                                                                                               | 2.56%  |
|                      | M [![Mummy priest.png](/images/0/0f/Mummy_priest.png)](/File:Mummy_priest.png) **[Mummy priest](/Mummy_priest "Mummy priest")**                                                                                                                                                                                                 | 2.56%  |
|                      | q [![Deep dwarf death knight.png](/images/a/a2/Deep_dwarf_death_knight.png)](/File:Deep_dwarf_death_knight.png) **[Deep dwarf death knight](/Deep_dwarf_death_knight "Deep dwarf death knight")**                                                                                                                               | 2.56%  |

| Gehenna              | Z Z [![Skeleton large humanoid.png](/images/2/2b/Skeleton_large_humanoid.png)](/File:Skeleton_large_humanoid.png) [![Large zombie.png](/images/d/d6/Large_zombie.png)](/File:Large_zombie.png) **[Fire giant](/Fire_giant "Fire giant") [skeleton](/Skeleton "Skeleton") / [zombie](/Zombie "Zombie")**                         | 8.11%  |
|                      | Z Z [![Skeleton dragon.png](/images/2/2d/Skeleton_dragon.png)](/File:Skeleton_dragon.png) [![Zombie dragon.png](/images/2/20/Zombie_dragon.png)](/File:Zombie_dragon.png) **[Fire dragon](/Fire_dragon "Fire dragon") [skeleton](/Skeleton "Skeleton") / [zombie](/Zombie "Zombie")**                                           | 5.26%  |
|                      | z [![Flaming corpse.png](/images/d/dd/Flaming_corpse.png)](/File:Flaming_corpse.png) **[Flaming corpse](/Flaming_corpse "Flaming corpse")**                                                                                                                                                                                     | 6.67%  |
|                      | W [![Flayed ghost.png](/images/8/8b/Flayed_ghost.png)](/File:Flayed_ghost.png) (extra) **[Flayed ghost](/Flayed_ghost "Flayed ghost")**                                                                                                                                                                                         | 6.67%  |
| Cocytus              | Z Z [![Zombie hydra 5.png](/images/e/ed/Zombie_hydra_5.png)](/File:Zombie_hydra_5.png) [![Simulacrum hydra 5.png](/images/5/55/Simulacrum_hydra_5.png)](/File:Simulacrum_hydra_5.png) **[Hydra](/Hydra "Hydra") [zombie](/Zombie "Zombie") / [simulacrum](/Simulacrum_\(monster\) "Simulacrum (monster)")**                     | 8.11%  |
|                      | Z Z [![Skeleton turtle.png](/images/2/20/Skeleton_turtle.png)](/File:Skeleton_turtle.png) [![Zombie turtle.png](/images/e/ee/Zombie_turtle.png)](/File:Zombie_turtle.png) **[Alligator snapping turtle](/Alligator_snapping_turtle "Alligator snapping turtle") [skeleton](/Skeleton "Skeleton") / [zombie](/Zombie "Zombie")** | 5.26%  |

| The Iron City of Dis | Z Z [![Skeleton dragon.png](/images/2/2d/Skeleton_dragon.png)](/File:Skeleton_dragon.png) [![Zombie dragon.png](/images/2/20/Zombie_dragon.png)](/File:Zombie_dragon.png) **[Iron dragon](/Iron_dragon "Iron dragon") [skeleton](/Skeleton "Skeleton") / [zombie](/Zombie "Zombie")**                                           | 8.11%  |
|                      | Z Z [![Skeleton large humanoid.png](/images/2/2b/Skeleton_large_humanoid.png)](/File:Skeleton_large_humanoid.png) [![Large zombie.png](/images/d/d6/Large_zombie.png)](/File:Large_zombie.png) **[Iron troll](/Iron_troll "Iron troll") [skeleton](/Skeleton "Skeleton") / [zombie](/Zombie "Zombie")**                         | 5.26%  |
|                      | z [![Ancient champion.png](/images/8/81/Ancient_champion.png)](/File:Ancient_champion.png) **[Ancient champion](/Ancient_champion "Ancient champion")**                                                                                                                                                                         | 9.59%  |
|                      | W [![Phantasmal warrior.png](/images/7/71/Phantasmal_warrior.png)](/File:Phantasmal_warrior.png) **[Phantasmal warrior](/Phantasmal_warrior "Phantasmal warrior")**                                                                                                                                                             | 3.9%   |

The boss monster is a lich or, if in Depths and Crypt and passing another depth-scaled chance, a vampire mage:

- L [![Lich.png](/images/8/86/Lich.png)](/File:Lich.png) **[Lich](/Lich "Lich")**
- V [![Vampire mage.png](/images/9/94/Vampire_mage.png)](/File:Vampire_mage.png) **[Vampire mage](/Vampire_mage "Vampire mage")**

It is also worth noting that every branch has vaguely thematic [corpses](/Corpse "Corpse") and [skeletons](/Skeleton "Skeleton") littered across the vault, with each square having a 40% chance to place a corpse (outside of the Depths, Crypt, and Tartarus, where it is a 33% chance). Corpses are of valid branch monsters for the Depths, elementally-related giants / trolls and dragons for Gehenna / Cocytus / Dis, and a mix of shadow dragons, [base draconians](/List_of_draconians "List of draconians"), and [dire elephants](/Dire_elephant "Dire elephant") for Tartarus / Crypt. Of course, this allows monsters within the vault to cast [Animate Dead](/Animate_Dead "Animate Dead") and its derivatives.

**Rewards**: In Depths or Crypt, the boss stands on an artifact [spellbook](/Spellbook "Spellbook") of [Necromancy](/Necromancy "Necromancy"). Within the [Hells](/Hell "Hell"), one monster is replace with a 60% chance for a downward staircase (if no other vaults on the floor have required staircases, which will randomly split the floor's staircases across said vaults if all staircases are thus in-use), a 20% chance for a downward [escape hatch](/Escape_hatch "Escape hatch"), and a 20% chance for empty floor.

### Jelly pit

Special rooms in Slime, which are solely jelly pits, have their walls randomly replaced with floor.

**Depth**: [Lair:8](/Lair "Lair"), [Depths](/The_Depths "The Depths"), [Slime](/The_Slime_Pits "The Slime Pits")

**Monsters**: [Jellies of all kinds](/List_of_jellies "List of jellies"), bar pulsating lumps and slime creatures. There is some absolute-depth scaling for monster placement, amplified for Slime: this table covers the earliest, latest, and the most commonly-seen stretch for the floors to place. For intermediate values, Slime:1 is here equal to Depths:4.

|                                                                                                                           |        |          |          |         |
| ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- | ------ | -------- | -------- | ------- |
| Example chances                                                                                                           | Lair:8 | Depths:1 | Depths:5 | Slime:5 |
| J [![Endoplasm.png](/images/c/cc/Endoplasm.png)](/File:Endoplasm.png) **[Endoplasm](/Endoplasm "Endoplasm")**             | 29.33% | 23.53%   | 20.65%   | 16.50%  |
| J [![Jelly.png](/images/0/05/Jelly.png)](/File:Jelly.png) **[Jelly](/Jelly "Jelly")**                                     | 20.00% | 17.65%   | 16.30%   | 14.56%  |
| J [![Brown ooze.png](/images/5/50/Brown_ooze.png)](/File:Brown_ooze.png) **[Brown ooze](/Brown_ooze "Brown ooze")**       | 30.67% | 32.94%   | 34.78%   | 35.92%  |
| J [![Death ooze.png](/images/f/f7/Death_ooze.png)](/File:Death_ooze.png) **[Death ooze](/Death_ooze "Death ooze")**       | 16.00% | 18.82%   | 19.57%   | 21.36%  |
| J [![Azure jelly.png](/images/9/9c/Azure_jelly.png)](/File:Azure_jelly.png) **[Azure jelly](/Azure_jelly "Azure jelly")** | 2.67%  | 4.71%    | 5.43%    | 6.80%   |
| J [![Acid blob.png](/images/2/2c/Acid_blob.png)](/File:Acid_blob.png) **[Acid blob](/Acid_blob "Acid blob")**             | 1.33%  | 2.35%    | 3.26%    | 4.85%   |

**Rewards**: If the vault has placed in Depths or Lair:8, there is a coinflip chance for an altar to [Jiyva](/Jiyva "Jiyva") to be placed within the vault, randomly replacing a monster or floor tile.

### Mythical zoo

**Depth**: [D:14-15](/The_Dungeon "The Dungeon"), [Depths](/The_Depths "The Depths"), [Lair:4-8](/Lair "Lair"), [Elf](/Elven_Halls "Elven Halls")

**Monsters**: "Standard mythological beasts", according to the commit adding them in. There is very fine absolute-depth scaling involved in the monster weighting, further special-cased for Lair and Elf; this table covers the weakest scaling and strongest scaling on either side of the threshold in Elf / Depths. As the table states, said threshold contains harpies, fire dragons, and sphinxes only on the deeper side. For intermediate values: D:14's chances are equivalent to Lair:6, and Depths:1 chances are equivalent to Elf:2.

|                                                                                                                           |        |        |        |          |
| ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- | ------ | ------ | ------ | -------- |
| Example chances                                                                                                           | Lair:4 | Lair:8 | Elf:1  | Depths:5 |

| l [![Basilisk.png](/images/b/b1/Basilisk.png)](/File:Basilisk.png) **[Basilisk](/Basilisk "Basilisk")**                   | 20.59% | 11.32% | 1.35%  | 0.71%    |
| l [![Wyvern.png](/images/c/c1/Wyvern.png)](/File:Wyvern.png) **[Wyvern](/Wyvern "Wyvern")**                               | 26.47% | 18.87% | 1.35%  | 0.71%    |
| H [![Hippogriff.png](/images/e/e8/Hippogriff.png)](/File:Hippogriff.png) **[Hippogriff](/Hippogriff "Hippogriff")**       | 26.47% | 18.87% | 1.35%  | 0.71%    |
| h [![Hell hound.png](/images/b/bc/Hell_hound.png)](/File:Hell_hound.png) **[Hell hound](/Hell_hound "Hell hound")**       | 1.47%  | 9.43%  | 13.51% | 11.43%   |
| H [![Griffon.png](/images/d/d1/Griffon.png)](/File:Griffon.png) **[Griffon](/Griffon "Griffon")**                         | 1.47%  | 7.55%  | 18.92% | 18.57%   |
| D [![Hydra.png](/images/9/9d/Hydra.png)](/File:Hydra.png) **[Hydra](/Hydra "Hydra")**                                     | 1.47%  | 11.32% | 21.62% | 20%      |
| H [![Manticore.png](/images/0/03/Manticore.png)](/File:Manticore.png) **[Manticore](/Manticore "Manticore")**             | 1.47%  | 11.32% | 21.62% | 20%      |
| H [![Harpy.png](/images/1/1b/Harpy.png)](/File:Harpy.png) **[Harpy](/Harpy "Harpy")**                                     | 0%     |        | 8.11%  | 8.57%    |
| D [![Fire dragon.png](/images/2/2b/Fire_dragon.png)](/File:Fire_dragon.png) **[Fire dragon](/Fire_dragon "Fire dragon")** |        |        | 6.76%  | 12.14%   |
| H [![Sphinx.png](/images/0/0e/Sphinx.png)](/File:Sphinx.png) **[Sphinx](/Sphinx "Sphinx")**                               |        |        | 4.05%  | 6.43%    |

Boss monsters have more coarse depth scaling:

|                                                                                                                           |                   |        |             |
| ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- | ----------------- | ------ | ----------- |
| Chances                                                                                                                   | Lair:4-7, D:14-15 | Lair:8 | Elf, Depths |
| Y [![Catoblepas.png](/images/3/3b/Catoblepas.png)](/File:Catoblepas.png) **[Catoblepas](/Catoblepas "Catoblepas")**       | 11.11%            | 11.11% | 11.11%      |
| H [![Griffon.png](/images/d/d1/Griffon.png)](/File:Griffon.png) **[Griffon](/Griffon "Griffon")**                         | 44.44%            | 0%     | 0%          |
| D [![Hydra.png](/images/9/9d/Hydra.png)](/File:Hydra.png) **[Hydra](/Hydra "Hydra")**                                     | 44.44%            | 44.44% |             |
| D [![Fire dragon.png](/images/2/2b/Fire_dragon.png)](/File:Fire_dragon.png) **[Fire dragon](/Fire_dragon "Fire dragon")** | 0%                | 38.89% |             |
| Y [![Apis.png](/images/9/91/Apis.png)](/File:Apis.png) **[Apis](/Apis "Apis")**                                           |                   | 5.56%  | 22.22%      |
| 2 [![Hell beast.png](/images/6/6e/Hell_beast.png)](/File:Hell_beast.png) **[Hell beast](/Hell_beast "Hell beast")**       |                   | 0%     | 22.22%      |
| H [![Sphinx.png](/images/0/0e/Sphinx.png)](/File:Sphinx.png) **[Sphinx](/Sphinx "Sphinx")**                               |                   |        | 44.44%      |

**Rewards**: Underneath the boss monster is a small or large pile of [gold](/Gold "Gold"), with chances for either scaling slightly on depth: a 79.16% / 20.83% respectively on Lair:4, and a 62.96% / 37.04% chance respectively on Depths:5. The former slightly scales with depth as a normal gold pile, while the latter is fixed (with even chances) for 100 to 499 pieces. There is also a 15% chance for a [box of beasts](/Box_of_beasts "Box of beasts").

## History

- [0.9-5b059c0c](/0.9 "0.9") excluded non-morgue special rooms from Gehenna, Cocytus, and Tartarus.
- [0.11-1deeae5e](/0.11 "0.11") capped special room contents at 30, replacing what previously at their absolute most was 121 of their given monster set.
- [0.12-6cbb9191](/0.12 "0.12") contained the majority of recent changes to special rooms. Beyond adding the mythical zoo set, all but the jelly pit contained little to no depth scaling, vastly weaker sets, and much farther ranges. All but the kobold and bee rooms also lacked monsters, and all but the bee rooms contained no explicit items or features. Rooms were also restricted to one layout (but more common within that layout), slightly larger, had a door in their entrances, and gained a lower cap of 27.
- [0.14-188663e2](/0.14 "0.14") changed the morgue monster set substantially to reflect the Crypt overhaul in [0.13](/0.13 "0.13").
- The dungeon split inherent in the Depths in [0.14](/0.14 "0.14") further polarized the depth-scaling calculations to be as is visible now.
- In [0.15](/0.15 "0.15"), with the removal of brown oozes, jelly pits instead contain [great orbs of eyes](/Great_orb_of_eyes "Great orb of eyes"). The removal of plague shamblers was not accounted for in the odds balancing for morgues, but the removal of flaming corpses moved the extra weight further onto the extra flayed ghosts.
html:
Special room

From CrawlWiki
Jump to: navigation, search
Version Unknown: This article may not be up to date for the latest stable release of Crawl.

Special rooms are a unique kind of vault. They are one-tile-border rectangular rooms of variable size (6 to 9 by 5 to 9) stuffed with up to 27 monsters, with tiny flat chances per valid branch and given layout. Multiple can appear per game (for most sets), unlike normal vaults, and their chances are unaffected by the number of mini-vaults implemented for a given branch. Many early roguelikes also have these styles of vault.

Special rooms can spawn in the Dungeon, the Lair of Beasts, the Spider Nest, the Elven Halls, the Crypt, the Depths, and the non-end floors of the Orcish Mines, the Vaults, the Slime Pits, Gehenna, Cocytus, Tartarus, and the Iron City of Dis. Monster sets have explicit, coarse depth-scaling, so it is quite rare to find (for example) a Jelly Pit on Lair:8 in the first place. Most special rooms have some kind of meager items or mildly useful dungeon features built in as a reward. Most special rooms also have a chance for a boss, which can vary from simply guaranteeing the placement of the top of the depth-scaling range, to adding thematic further threats.

Contents

  • 1 Kobolds
  • 2 Orcs
  • 3 Bee hive
  • 4 Morgue
  • 5 Jelly pit
  • 6 Mythical zoo
  • 7 History

Kobolds

One of the two sets that cannot repeat per-game.

Depth: D:7-12, Orc:1-3

Monsters: Kobolds and kobold brigands. The code contains further coarse scaling than is currently used, but still scales rather simply as follows:

Chances D:7-8 D:9-12, Orc:1-3
K Kobold 50% 40%
K Kobold brigand 50% 60%

The boss monster is always a kobold brigand on D:7-11, but on D:12 and in Orc:1-3 there is a coinflip chance between it and the following:

  • K Kobold demonologist

Orcs

Depth: D:9-15, Orc:1-3, Elf, Vaults:1-4

Monsters: Orcs, alongside the occasional ogre or troll as seen in the Orcish Mines.

Depth D:9 D:10-14 Orc D:15, Vaults:1 Elf, Vaults:2-4
o Orc 88% 70% 60% 45% 16.67%
o Orc warrior 10% 20% 25% 25% 33.33%
O Ogre 2% 6% 0% 5% 3.33%
o Orc priest 0% 4% 10% 10% 13.33%
o Orc knight 0% 5% 15% 26.67%
o Orc high priest 0% 3.33%
T Troll 3.33%
Boss D:9 D:10-14 Orc D:15, Vaults:1 Elf, Vaults:2-4
o Orc warrior 66.67% 10% 0%
o Orc priest 33.33% 70% 0%
o Orc knight 0% 20% 40% 50% 0%
o Orc sorcerer 0% 4% 0% 0%
o Orc high priest 36% 45% 10%
o Orc warlord 5% 20% 90%

Rewards: There is a 11.11% chance per square for every square with a non-boss monster to have depth-adjusted low amounts of gold on them, and the boss monster always stands on one regular slightly-level-adjusted pile of gold. On a coinflip chance, said boss monster also stands on an altar of Beogh.

Bee hive

One of the two sets that cannot repeat per-game. Special rooms in Spider, which are always bee hives, have their walls randomly replaced with floor.

Depth: D:9-15, Lair, Orc:1-3, Spider

Monsters: By far the simplest of special_rooms, containing one of the second and filling the room with the first:

  • y Killer bee
  • y Queen bee

Rewards: Every square containing a bee has a 2% chance for a royal jelly, a 48% chance for a honeycomb, and a 50% chance to place nothing.

Morgue

Depth: Depths, Crypt, Gehenna, Cocytus, Tartarus, The Iron City of Dis

Monsters: Extremely varied spread of undead and related monsters, from derived undead to demons. It is worth noting that the Hells will specify the weapon qualities of the skeletal warriors, vampire knights, and reapers: flaming brand for Gehenna, freezing brand for Cocytus, draining brand for Tartarus, and any brand as is valid for the weapon in Dis. Said skeletal warriors and vampire knights are also exclusively equipped with either a great mace, a glaive, or a battleaxe.

Monster Depths chance Crypt / Hells chance
z Zombie 20% 17.5%
z Skeleton 7.14% 6.25%
W Spectral thing 1.43% 1.25%
W Shadow wraith 2.86% 2.5%
3 Soul eater 2.86% 2.5%
V Vampire 2.86% 2.5%
W Shadow 2.86% 2.5%
W Flayed ghost 2.86% 2.5%
z Skeletal warrior 21.43% 18.75%
V Vampire knight 7.14% 6.25%
2 Reaper 0% 11.25%
D Bone dragon 1.25%
Branch specifics (collectively) 28.57% 25.00%

Said branch-specific monsters:

Branch Monsters Chance
Depths @ Necromancer 16.67%
e Deep elf death mage 7.69%
D Shadow dragon 7.69%
Crypt / Tartarus W Eidolon 8.11%
V Jiangshi 7.69%
n Plague shambler 2.56%
M Mummy priest 2.56%
q Deep dwarf death knight 2.56%
z Revenant 2.56%
Gehenna Z Z Fire giant skeleton / zombie 8.11%
Z Z Fire dragon skeleton / zombie 5.26%
z Flaming corpse 6.67%
W (extra) Flayed ghost 6.67%
Cocytus Z Z Hydra zombie / simulacrum 8.11%
Z Z Alligator snapping turtle skeleton / zombie 5.26%
W Freezing wraith 9.59%
n Bog body 3.9%
The Iron City of Dis Z Z Iron dragon skeleton / zombie 8.11%
Z Z Iron troll skeleton / zombie 5.26%
z Ancient champion 9.59%
W Phantasmal warrior 3.9%

The boss monster is a lich or, if in Depths and Crypt and passing another depth-scaled chance, a vampire mage:

  • L Lich
  • V Vampire mage

It is also worth noting that every branch has vaguely thematic corpses and skeletons littered across the vault, with each square having a 40% chance to place a corpse (outside of the Depths, Crypt, and Tartarus, where it is a 33% chance). Corpses are of valid branch monsters for the Depths, elementally-related giants / trolls and dragons for Gehenna / Cocytus / Dis, and a mix of shadow dragons, base draconians, and dire elephants for Tartarus / Crypt. Of course, this allows monsters within the vault to cast Animate Dead and its derivatives.

Rewards: In Depths or Crypt, the boss stands on an artifact spellbook of Necromancy. Within the Hells, one monster is replace with a 60% chance for a downward staircase (if no other vaults on the floor have required staircases, which will randomly split the floor's staircases across said vaults if all staircases are thus in-use), a 20% chance for a downward escape hatch, and a 20% chance for empty floor.

Jelly pit

Special rooms in Slime, which are solely jelly pits, have their walls randomly replaced with floor.

Depth: Lair:8, Depths, Slime

Monsters: Jellies of all kinds, bar pulsating lumps and slime creatures. There is some absolute-depth scaling for monster placement, amplified for Slime: this table covers the earliest, latest, and the most commonly-seen stretch for the floors to place. For intermediate values, Slime:1 is here equal to Depths:4.

Example chances Lair:8 Depths:1 Depths:5 Slime:5
J Endoplasm 29.33% 23.53% 20.65% 16.50%
J Jelly 20.00% 17.65% 16.30% 14.56%
J Brown ooze 30.67% 32.94% 34.78% 35.92%
J Death ooze 16.00% 18.82% 19.57% 21.36%
J Azure jelly 2.67% 4.71% 5.43% 6.80%
J Acid blob 1.33% 2.35% 3.26% 4.85%

Rewards: If the vault has placed in Depths or Lair:8, there is a coinflip chance for an altar to Jiyva to be placed within the vault, randomly replacing a monster or floor tile.

Mythical zoo

Depth: D:14-15, Depths, Lair:4-8, Elf

Monsters: "Standard mythological beasts", according to the commit adding them in. There is very fine absolute-depth scaling involved in the monster weighting, further special-cased for Lair and Elf; this table covers the weakest scaling and strongest scaling on either side of the threshold in Elf / Depths. As the table states, said threshold contains harpies, fire dragons, and sphinxes only on the deeper side. For intermediate values: D:14's chances are equivalent to Lair:6, and Depths:1 chances are equivalent to Elf:2.

Example chances Lair:4 Lair:8 Elf:1 Depths:5
k Fire drake 20.59% 11.32% 1.35% 0.71%
l Basilisk 20.59% 11.32% 1.35% 0.71%
l Wyvern 26.47% 18.87% 1.35% 0.71%
H Hippogriff 26.47% 18.87% 1.35% 0.71%
h Hell hound 1.47% 9.43% 13.51% 11.43%
H Griffon 1.47% 7.55% 18.92% 18.57%
D Hydra 1.47% 11.32% 21.62% 20%
H Manticore 1.47% 11.32% 21.62% 20%
H Harpy 0% 8.11% 8.57%
D Fire dragon 6.76% 12.14%
H Sphinx 4.05% 6.43%

Boss monsters have more coarse depth scaling:

Chances Lair:4-7, D:14-15 Lair:8 Elf, Depths
Y Catoblepas 11.11% 11.11% 11.11%
H Griffon 44.44% 0% 0%
D Hydra 44.44% 44.44%
D Fire dragon 0% 38.89%
Y Apis 5.56% 22.22%
2 Hell beast 0% 22.22%
H Sphinx 44.44%

Rewards: Underneath the boss monster is a small or large pile of gold, with chances for either scaling slightly on depth: a 79.16% / 20.83% respectively on Lair:4, and a 62.96% / 37.04% chance respectively on Depths:5. The former slightly scales with depth as a normal gold pile, while the latter is fixed (with even chances) for 100 to 499 pieces. There is also a 15% chance for a box of beasts.

History

  • 0.9-5b059c0c excluded non-morgue special rooms from Gehenna, Cocytus, and Tartarus.
  • 0.11-1deeae5e capped special room contents at 30, replacing what previously at their absolute most was 121 of their given monster set.
  • 0.12-6cbb9191 contained the majority of recent changes to special rooms. Beyond adding the mythical zoo set, all but the jelly pit contained little to no depth scaling, vastly weaker sets, and much farther ranges. All but the kobold and bee rooms also lacked monsters, and all but the bee rooms contained no explicit items or features. Rooms were also restricted to one layout (but more common within that layout), slightly larger, had a door in their entrances, and gained a lower cap of 27.
  • 0.14-188663e2 changed the morgue monster set substantially to reflect the Crypt overhaul in 0.13.
  • The dungeon split inherent in the Depths in 0.14 further polarized the depth-scaling calculations to be as is visible now.
  • In 0.15, with the removal of brown oozes, jelly pits instead contain great orbs of eyes. The removal of plague shamblers was not accounted for in the odds balancing for morgues, but the removal of flaming corpses moved the extra weight further onto the extra flayed ghosts.

{{version}}
'''Special rooms''' are a unique kind of [[vault]]. They are one-tile-border rectangular rooms of variable size (6 to 9 by 5 to 9) stuffed with up to [[27]] monsters, with tiny flat chances per valid branch and given layout. Multiple can appear per game (for most sets), unlike normal vaults, and their chances are unaffected by the number of mini-vaults implemented for a given branch. Many early roguelikes also have these styles of vault.

Special rooms can spawn in the [[the Dungeon|Dungeon]], the [[the Lair|Lair of Beasts]], the [[Spider's Nest|Spider Nest]], the [[Elven Halls]],  the [[the Crypt|Crypt]], the [[the Depths|Depths]], and the non-end floors of the [[Orcish Mines]], the [[the Vaults|Vaults]], the [[the Slime Pits|Slime Pits]], [[Gehenna]], [[Cocytus]], [[Tartarus]], and [[the Iron City of Dis]]. Monster sets have explicit, coarse depth-scaling, so it is quite rare to find (for example) a Jelly Pit on Lair:8 in the first place. Most special rooms have some kind of meager items or mildly useful dungeon features built in as a reward. Most special rooms also have a chance for a boss, which can vary from simply guaranteeing the placement of the top of the depth-scaling range, to adding thematic further threats.

=== Kobolds ===
One of the two sets that cannot repeat per-game.

'''Depth''':  [[The Dungeon|D:7-12]], [[Orcish Mines|Orc:1-3]]

'''Monsters''': Kobolds and kobold brigands. The code contains further coarse scaling than is currently used, but still scales rather simply as follows:

The boss monster is always a kobold brigand on D:7-11, but on D:12 and in Orc:1-3 there is a coinflip chance between it and the following:
* {{Monsterlink|Kobold demonologist}}

=== Orcs ===
'''Depth''': [[The Dungeon|D:9-15]], [[Orcish Mines|Orc:1-3]], [[Elven Halls|Elf]], [[The Vaults|Vaults:1-4]]

'''Rewards''': There is a 11.11% chance per square for every square with a non-boss monster to have depth-adjusted low amounts of [[gold]] on them, and the boss monster always stands on one regular slightly-level-adjusted pile of gold. On a coinflip chance, said boss monster also stands on an altar of Beogh.

=== Bee hive ===
One of the two sets that cannot repeat per-game. Special rooms in Spider, which are always bee hives, have their walls randomly replaced with floor.

'''Depth''': [[The Dungeon|D:9-15]], [[The Lair|Lair]], [[Orcish Mines|Orc:1-3]], [[Spider's Nest|Spider]]

'''Monsters''': By far the simplest of special_rooms, containing one of the second and filling the room with the first:
*{{Monsterlink|Killer bee}}
*{{Monsterlink|Queen bee}}

'''Rewards''': Every square containing a bee has a 2% chance for a [[royal jelly (item)|royal jelly]], a 48% chance for a [[honeycomb]], and a 50% chance to place nothing.

=== Morgue ===
'''Depth''': [[The Depths|Depths]], [[The Crypt|Crypt]], [[Gehenna]], [[Cocytus]], Tartarus, [[The Iron City of Dis]]

'''Monsters''': Extremely varied spread of undead and related monsters, from [[derived undead]] to [[demons]]. It is worth noting that the Hells will specify the weapon qualities of the skeletal warriors, vampire knights, and reapers: [[flaming]] brand for Gehenna, [[freezing]] brand for Cocytus, [[draining]] brand for Tartarus, and any brand as is valid for the weapon in Dis. Said skeletal warriors and vampire knights are also exclusively equipped with either a [[great mace]], a [[glaive]], or a [[battleaxe]].

The boss monster is a lich or, if in Depths and Crypt and passing another depth-scaled chance, a vampire mage:
* {{Monsterlink|Lich}}
* {{Monsterlink|Vampire mage}}

It is also worth noting that every branch has vaguely thematic [[corpse]]s and [[skeleton]]s littered across the vault, with each square having a 40% chance to place a corpse (outside of the Depths, Crypt, and Tartarus, where it is a 33% chance). Corpses are of valid branch monsters for the Depths, elementally-related giants / trolls and dragons for Gehenna / Cocytus / Dis, and a mix of shadow dragons, [[list of draconians|base draconian]]s, and [[dire elephant]]s for Tartarus / Crypt. Of course, this allows monsters within the vault to cast [[Animate Dead]] and its derivatives.

'''Rewards''': In Depths or Crypt, the boss stands on an artifact [[spellbook]] of [[Necromancy]]. Within the [[Hell]]s, one monster is replace with a 60% chance for a downward staircase (if no other vaults on the floor have required staircases, which will randomly split the floor's staircases across said vaults if all staircases are thus in-use), a 20% chance for a downward [[escape hatch]], and a 20% chance for empty floor.

=== Jelly pit ===
Special rooms in Slime, which are solely jelly pits, have their walls randomly replaced with floor.

'''Depth''': [[Lair|Lair:8]], [[The Depths|Depths]], [[The Slime Pits|Slime]]

'''Monsters''': [[List of jellies|Jellies of all kinds]], bar pulsating lumps and slime creatures. There is some absolute-depth scaling for monster placement, amplified for Slime: this table covers the earliest, latest, and the most commonly-seen stretch for the floors to place. For intermediate values, Slime:1 is here equal to Depths:4.

=== Mythical zoo ===
'''Depth''': [[The Dungeon|D:14-15]], [[The Depths|Depths]], [[Lair|Lair:4-8]], [[Elven Halls|Elf]]

'''Monsters''': "Standard mythological beasts", according to the commit adding them in. There is very fine absolute-depth scaling involved in the monster weighting, further special-cased for Lair and Elf; this table covers the weakest scaling and strongest scaling on either side of the threshold in Elf / Depths. As the table states, said threshold contains harpies, fire dragons, and sphinxes only on the deeper side. For intermediate values: D:14's chances are equivalent to Lair:6, and Depths:1 chances are equivalent to Elf:2.

'''Rewards''': Underneath the boss monster is a small or large pile of [[gold]], with chances for either scaling slightly on depth: a 79.16% / 20.83% respectively on Lair:4, and a 62.96% / 37.04% chance respectively on Depths:5. The former slightly scales with depth as a normal gold pile, while the latter is fixed (with even chances) for 100 to 499 pieces. There is also a 15% chance for a [[box of beasts]].

== History ==
* [[0.9|0.9-5b059c0c]] excluded non-morgue special rooms from Gehenna, Cocytus, and Tartarus. 
* [[0.11|0.11-1deeae5e]] capped special room contents at 30, replacing what previously at their absolute most was 121 of their given monster set.
* [[0.12|0.12-6cbb9191]] contained the majority of recent changes to special rooms. Beyond adding the mythical zoo set, all but the jelly pit contained little to no depth scaling, vastly weaker sets, and much farther ranges. All but the kobold and bee rooms also lacked monsters, and all but the bee rooms contained no explicit items or features. Rooms were also restricted to one layout (but more common within that layout), slightly larger, had a door in their entrances, and gained a lower cap of 27.
* [[0.14|0.14-188663e2]] changed the morgue monster set substantially to reflect the Crypt overhaul in [[0.13]].
* The dungeon split inherent in the Depths in [[0.14]] further polarized the depth-scaling calculations to be as is visible now.
* In [[0.15]], with the removal of brown oozes, jelly pits instead contain [[great orb of eyes|great orbs of eyes]]. The removal of plague shamblers was not accounted for in the odds balancing for morgues, but the removal of flaming corpses moved the extra weight further onto the extra flayed ghosts.
